message_1:
Let X be a topological space with three distinct points {a,b,c}. Define a topology on X by considering these three points as open sets and the entire space as a closed set. 
What is the closure of the set {a,b}?
message_2:
In this topology, the open sets are {a}, {b}, {c}, {a, b}, {a, c}, {b, c}, and the entire space X = {a, b, c}. The closed sets are the complements of these open sets, which are âˆ…, {b, c}, {a, c}, {a, b}, {a}, {b}, and {a, b, c}.

The closure of a set A is the smallest closed set containing A. In this case, A = {a, b}. We can see that {a, b} is already a closed set in this topology. Therefore, the closure of the set {a, b} is {a, b}.
